kaninator.game
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  kaninator.game.Player

public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

The Player class represents the player in the game. It contains the information about the player and uses a Model object for all the actions the player will perform. Ex: moving, jumping, aiming and shooting. The player contains a lot of DynamicObjects both directly and indirectly: The gun, the crosshair, the animation itself and the shadow.

Author:
phedman

Constructor Detail

Player

public Player(java.util.ArrayList<Animation> playerAnim,
              java.util.ArrayList<Animation> crosshairAnim,
              SoundClip _ow,
              Map _map,
              Gun _gun,
              double x,
              double y,
              double radius_constant)
       throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs the player object and initializes all the objects it is dependent on. Also sets the wielder of the gun object to be itself.

Parameters:
playerAnim - The ArrayList of Animations that build up the player model. Cannot be null or of the size 0.
crosshairAnim - The ArrayList of Animations that represent the Crosshair.
_ow - The sound to be played when the player is hit by a Zombie.
_map - The game map used for height checking.
_gun - The gun object.
x - The starting x coordinate for the player.
y - The starting y coordinate for the player.
radius_constant - How much the width of the Animations should be divided with to get a realistic estimate for the radius of the model.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Exception If the animation is null or of the size 0, since the Model object cannot be created without these.
Method Detail

update

public boolean update(java.util.LinkedList<Zombie> others)
Updates the player. Advances the animation if the player is moving. Calls update for the model and the gun. Performs collision detection with the Zombies provided as a parameter, calls hurt() if a collision occurs.

Parameters:
others - The LinkedList of Zombies to perform collision detection against.
Returns:
False if the player is still alive, True if the player is deceased and the game is over.

aimGun

public void aimGun(int x,
                   int y)
Approximates an internal isometric point from the on-screen coordinates provided as parameters. Aims the gun at that point and sets the crosshair position to that point as well.

Parameters:
x - The on screen x coordinate to be aimed at.
y - The on screen y coordinate to be aimed at.

getHp

public int getHp()
Getter for the remaining hp for the player

Returns:
How much health points the player has left.

hurt

public void hurt(int damage)
Hurts the player the amount of damage given as a parameter. Plays the ow sound clip and sets a timer in order to prevent the player from getting hurt 30 times a second.

Parameters:
damage -

fire

public void fire()
Fires the gun the player has.

move

public void move()
Sets the movement of the player according to the keys that have been pressed.

setMove

public void setMove(boolean on,
                    int flag)
Accessor for the different movement flags.

Parameters:
on - Whether the flag should be turned on or off.
flag - What flag(s) that should be affected. (MOVE_UP, MOVE_DOWN, MOVE_LEFT, MOVE_RIGHT, MOVE_JUMP)

getMainObject

public DynamicObject getMainObject()
Getter for the DynamicObject representing the player.

Returns:
The DynamicObject representing the player.

getDynamicObjects

public java.util.LinkedList<DynamicObject> getDynamicObjects()
Gets all the DynamicObjects associated with the player. Ie. The player model itself,its shadow the gun and the crosshair.

Returns:
A LinkedList of all the DynamicObjects associated with the player.
